The Introductory Verses
The face of the Blessed One,

I pay homage with a pure mind.

Those who see this policy, peaceful,

The SÅ«raâ€™s Recollections
Gratitude and truthfulness,
These two are the essence of the world;
The worlds stand by them,
They made the king powerful.
Crows and bad people in the world,
Are always like a garland of flowers;
They destroy the desired good qualities,
They are indeed the enemies of the world.
The jackal is the enemy of deer,
And the hawk is the enemy of birds.
They are causeless enemies,
Like fishermen are to fish;
The good and the virtuous,
The wicked are always enemies.
You should sleep well, sirs, with glory,
For glory is the root of prosperity;
Glory shines here,
That glory is all-accomplishing.
Falsehood is the darkness of the world,
Truth is the maker of light;
By the darkness of falsehood one suffers,
By the light of truth one attains happiness.ğŸ”½The cries of jackals and birds
Are well known,
But the cries of men, O king,
Are more difficult to know.
Jealousy is like a lightning bolt,
It burns up all prosperity;
Joy is like a rain cloud,
It increases all prosperity.
Just as pillars without joints,
